skill.name: epub-chapter-extractor
skill.description: Extract all chapters from an EPUB file into separate markdown files. Use when the user wants to split an EPUB into individual chapter files, extract EPUB chapters, or convert an ebook to separate markdown documents.
skill.summary: Extract all chapters from an EPUB file into separate markdown files. Use when the user wants to spli...
skill.author: Abilityai

security_audit.summary: Legitimate document conversion tool with minimal risk. Reads EPUB files and writes markdown files to user-specified locations. No network activity, no data exfiltration, no obfuscated code.

content.value_statement: Converting ebooks to separate chapter files takes time and requires specialized tools. This skill automatically extracts each chapter from an EPUB into its own markdown file with proper formatting and numbering.
actual_capabilities: Extract all chapters from EPUB files into separate markdown files
Automatically number output files for proper sorting
Convert HTML content to clean markdown format
Handle nested table of contents with hierarchy levels
Clean HTML by removing scripts, styles, and empty tags
Create organized output folders named after the source EPUB
limitations: Only supports EPUB format, not PDF, MOBI, or other ebook formats
Requires Python dependencies: ebooklib, beautifulsoup4, html2text, lxml
Cannot preserve complex formatting like tables or multi-column layouts
May not work with DRM-protected or encrypted EPUB files

use_cases.title: Extract research book chapters
use_cases.description: Convert academic ebooks into individual chapter files for easier reference and citation management

use_cases.title: Organize long-form content
use_cases.description: Break down multi-author anthologies or textbooks into separate documents for focused reading

use_cases.title: Prepare ebook content for blogs
use_cases.description: Convert ebook chapters into markdown for republishing as blog posts or articles

prompt_templates.title: Basic extraction
prompt_templates.scenario: Extract chapters from an EPUB file

prompt_templates.title: Process existing file
prompt_templates.scenario: Work with file in known path

prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all chapters from the textbook.epub in my downloads folder so I can analyze each chapter separately

best_practices: Place EPUB files in a dedicated folder before extraction for organized output
Use descriptive EPUB filenames to create meaningful output folder names
Verify extracted markdown files retain chapter headings for navigation
anti_patterns: Do not use on DRM-protected ebooks as extraction may violate terms of service
Do not expect complex formatting like tables to transfer perfectly
Do not assume all EPUB files have properly structured table of contents

faq.question: What ebook formats are supported?
faq.answer: Only EPUB format is supported. PDF, MOBI, AZW, and other formats require different tools.

faq.question: Can I extract protected or DRM files?
faq.answer: DRM-protected files cannot be extracted and may violate copyright or license terms.

faq.question: How are output files named?
faq.answer: Files are numbered sequentially like 01_chapter_title.md for proper filesystem sorting.

faq.question: Where are extracted files saved?
faq.answer: By default, files are saved to a folder named after the EPUB in the same directory as the source file.

faq.question: What dependencies are required?
faq.answer: The skill uses ebooklib, beautifulsoup4, html2text, and lxml which are installed via uv run.

faq.question: How does this compare to Calibre?
faq.answer: This is a focused command-line tool for markdown extraction. Calibre offers more format support but requires GUI.
